programme.title: Liverpool vs. Arsenal - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Liverpool are winless in six Premier League matches against Arsenal, their longest winless run against the Gunners since going eight without a win between October 2007 and April 2011. programme.title: Newcastle United vs. Liverpool - English Premier League 2025/2026

programme.desc: Levante UD have won three of their last four LaLiga home games against Real Betis, scoring exactly four goals in those three victories, the same number of wins as in the rest of the Green and Whites visits to the Granota ground in the competition. Real Betis have won their last three matches against Levante in LaLiga and have only once managed more consecutive victories against them in the top-flight: five between 2014 and 2018.

programme.title: Al Ahli (KSA) vs Kawasaki (JPN) - AFC Champions League Elite 2024/25 - Final
programme.desc: Al-Ahli will face Kawasaki Frontale for the first time in the AFC Champions League elite and for the first time against a Japanese team. Conversely, this will be Kawasaki Frontales second encounter against a Saudi team after defeating Al-Nassr 3-2 in the semi-finals. Al-Ahli have won only once in 5 matches against East Asian teams, with the win against Shenzhen 2-1 in the 2005 quarter-finals. This will be the fourth final between a Saudi team and a Japanese team in the AFC Champions League elite, the most common final matchup in the tournament. All previous finals were between Al-Hilal and Urawa Red Diamonds, with Al-Hilal winning one title in 2019 and Urawa winning two titles in 2017 and 2

programme.title: Jordan Road to FIFA World Cup 2026
programme.desc: The Jordanian national team achieved a historic achievement by qualifying for the World Cup finals for the first time in its history, making it the first Arab team to officially qualify for the next World Cup. We reminisce about the qualification process in this program.

programme.title: Asia Speaks Arab
programme.desc: Despite the pain, there was great hope for the Palestine national team, which brought joy to its fans by reaching the round of 16 for the first time in the tournament. Meanwhile, Syria soared to the round of 16 but exited narrowly against Iran.

programme.title: Pau vs Red Star - French Ligue 2 - 2025/2026
programme.desc: Ligue 2 is the second division of French football. Ligue 2 is contested by 18 clubs, the league operates on a system of promotion and relegation with both Ligue 1 and the third division Championnat National. The teams play 34 games each, totaling 306 games in the season. The biggest games from each match Day are live and exclusive on beIN.

programme.title: The Nashama of Asia
programme.desc: Jordan was close to achieving the lost dream when they distinguished themselves in the 2023 AFC Asian Cup by reaching an unprecedented final, confirming that they truly are the Al-Nashama of Asia.

programme.title: Huesca vs Malaga - LaLiga Hypermotion 2025-2026 - Spanish La liga 2
programme.desc: La Liga 2 is the mens second professional association football division of the Spanish football league system. It is contested by 22 teams, with the top two teams plus the winner of a play-off promoted to La Liga and replaced by the three lowest-placed teams in that division.

programme.title: Arturo COELLO ESP Agustin TAPIA ARG vs Martin DI NENNO ARG Leandro ROMAN AUGSBURGUER ARG - Men’s Fin
programme.desc: Madrid sets the stage for a thrilling men’s final at the 2025 Premier Padel P1. Top seeds Arturo Coello and Agustín Tapia, the reigning powerhouse duo blending Spanish flair with Argentine precision, take on the all-Argentine pair Martín Di Nenno and Leandro Augsburger. A clash of styles is guaranteed: Coello’s dominance at the net and Tapia’s explosive creativity tested by Di Nenno’s defensive wizardry and Augsburger’s fearless power. The ultimate battle for the P1 crown.

programme.title: PANENKA, GAME CHANGER
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how one man revolutionized football in 1976 by inventing a new way to take penalties—and unveiling it on the sport’s grandest and most dramatic stage.

programme.title: Canada vs USA - 3rd Place - 2025 FIBA AmeriCup
programme.desc: Bronze is on the line after a quick turnaround. The USA are record AmeriCup winners with seven titles, while Canada are chasing a statement podium. The senior series favors the USA 21–2, although the most recent major clash flipped the script: Canada beat the USA 127–118 after overtime for 2023 World Cup bronze in Manila. Their last AmeriCup meeting was the 2022 bronze game, which the USA won 84–80. Current FIBA Men’s World Ranking: USA No. 1, Canada No. 6. Bench depth, defensive rebounding, and three-point efficiency are likely to separate them.

programme.title: Argentina vs Brazil - Final - 2025 FIBA AmeriCup
programme.desc: South America’s classic rivalry decides the AmeriCup. Argentina are the reigning champions with three titles (2001, 2011, 2022), while Brazil are four-time winners (1984, 1988, 2005, 2009). Argentina lead the senior head-to-head 25–17. Their last AmeriCup meeting was the 2022 final in Recife, which Argentina won 75–73; at the 2019 World Cup second round, Argentina won 87–73. Current FIBA Men’s World Ranking: Argentina No. 8, Brazil No. 12. Expect a tactical game where turnover margin, second-chance points, and late free throws decide it.

programme.title: Morocco vs Nigeria - Final - Womens AFCON - Mini Match - 2025
programme.desc: Women Africa cup of nations Morocco 2024 is the 15th edition of the women African tournament, the second consecutive time hosted by Morocco, 12 national teams will compete from 5 till 26 of July 2025 to win the title.

programme.title: Qualifying - Catalonia GP - Moto GP - 2025
programme.desc: Timing and tow are crucial. Riders chase clear air yet seek a draft for the long straight. Clean sectors through fast, flowing corners set pole chances. Confidence and precision separate the front row from the pack.

programme.title: Sprint Race - Catalonia GP - Moto GP - 2025
programme.desc: Lightweight prototypes and fearless young riders produce pack racing at Barcelona-Catalunya. Slipstreams down the main straight, late braking and side-by-side cornering create constant lead changes. Race craft, tire feel and composure decide the podium.

programme.title: Main Race - Catalonia GP - Moto GP - 2025
programme.desc: Classic Moto3 drama: big groups, relentless overtakes and a sprint to the line. Slipstream runs decide moves into Turn 1 and the final chicane. Patience early, aggression late often wins in Barcelona.

programme.desc: DTM. The embodiment of Motorsport tradition. Having just turned 40, the DTM combines a unique fascination and familiarity with an unmistakable dynamic, signified by the rebranding with a new logo! Seven different manufacturers – ten different winners on six brands (Audi, BMW, Mercedes, Lamborghini, Porsche and Ferrari) through twelve races are but one testament to the unique competitive balance that makes every DTM weekend a revelation! And with the addition of Ford, the palette of different brands is only increasing!

programme.title: UEFA UCL Magazine 2025/2026-Play-off Review / USC Review / Draw Review
programme.desc: Luis Enrique and Ousmane Dembele, the key figures behind PSG’s triumph, look back on their landmark achievement of winning Europe’s ultimate club prize. The episode also unveils a cinematic journey through Udine, the host city of the 50th UEFA Super Cup, while capturing all the headlines from the 2025/26 UEFA Champions League League Phase draw. Among the season’s historic moments is Cypriot side Pafos making their debut in the competition, alongside three other newcomers. Finally, Brazilian legend Kaká reflects on his enduring bond with the Champions League trophy, which he famously lifted with AC Milan in 2007.

programme.title: Newcastle United vs Wolverhampton Wanderers - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 4
programme.desc: Newcastle United have lost just two of their 20 Premier League matches against Wolves, a defeat percentage of just 10% - their lowest against any side they’ve faced at least 20 times in the competition. Wolverhampton Wanderers have won just one of their last 22 away top-flight visits to Newcastle, winning 2-1 in December 2018 under Nuno Espírito Santo. In 43 away games at the Magpies in the top division, Wolves have just two clean sheets, with those coming in 1899 and 1974.

programme.title: Arsenal vs Nottingham Forest - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 4
programme.desc: In all competitions, Arsenal have won their last six home games against Nottingham Forest by an aggregate score of 19-2. The Gunners are unbeaten in 14 games on home soil against Forest since a 3-1 defeat back in March 1989. Nottingham Forest have won just two out of 16 Premier League matches against Arsenal and both wins came at the City Ground, in 1996-97 and 2022-23.

programme.title: Everton vs Aston Villa - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 4
programme.desc: Everton are winless in their last 12 Premier League matches against Aston Villa, all since Villa returned to the competition in 2019-20. Their last win was in March 2016, a 3-1 win at Villa Park. Aston Villa have won four of their last five away Premier League visits to Everton, keeping a clean sheet in each of their last four. It is Villa’s longest ever run of away league clean sheets against a single opponent.

programme.title: West Ham United vs Tottenham Hotspur - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 4
programme.desc: West Ham have won just one of their last seven Premier League matches against Tottenham Hotspur, a 2-1 away win in December 2023. Each of the last three Premier League meetings between West Ham and Spurs at the London Stadium have ended as 1-1 draws – Spurs are winless in five league visits since a 3-2 win in November 2019.

programme.title: Brentford vs Chelsea - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 4
programme.desc: Just one of the eight Premier League meetings between Brentford and Chelsea have been won by the home side, a 2-1 win for the Blues in December 2024. Brentford have won three Premier League matches against Chelsea but all of them have been away from home – at home, they are winless in four against the Blues.

programme.title: Al Ahli vs Al Wakrah - Qatar Stars League 2025/26 - W4
programme.desc: The Qatari League is the official football league in Qatar. The league includes 12 teams. The most famous participating clubs are Al-Sadd, the champions of the last season; Al-Rayyan and Al-Arabi, the popular teams, Al-Duhail and Al-Gharafa, serious contenders for the title every season. The Qatari league includes star names such as Firmino, Verratti, and Qatari Akram Afif, the best player in Asia.

programme.title: Race - Silverstone Round - European Le Mans Series - ELMS 2025
programme.desc: The FIA WEC returns to Europe for Round 2 at the historic Imola circuit. Top manufacturers like Ferrari, Toyota, and Porsche compete in a six-hour endurance battle, navigating 21 challenging turns over 4.9 km. Expect strategic pit stops, variable weather conditions, and fierce competition as teams vie for championship points in the Hypercar and LMGT3 classes.

programme.title: Chartres vs Montpellier - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germains 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: Al Duhail vs Um Salal - Qatar Stars League 2025/26 - W4
programme.desc: The Qatari League is the official football league in Qatar. The league includes 12 teams. The most famous participating clubs are Al-Sadd, the champions of the last season; Al-Rayyan and Al-Arabi, the popular teams, Al-Duhail and Al-Gharafa, serious contenders for the title every season. The Qatari league includes star names such as Firmino, Verratti, and Qatari Akram Afif, the best player in Asia.
